diff_hunk:
@@ -1399,15 +1399,23 @@
   variants: function
 
 
+# NB: The function overloads are removed to avoid a nasty bug where
+# you say at::native_sparse_coo_tensor(indices, values), and then
+# it does the dispatch based on indices (wrong wrong wrong!)  Without
+# the variants, you must call this on type directly.
+#
+# Maybe this meant we were supposed to take a dtype as an argument here.
+# Hmmmmm.
body:
That's not unreasonable, although it wouldn't be enough for this case, because neither argument is the actual type you want the dispatch to happen on in the end.

Actually, when C10 dispatcher lands none of this will matter because you won't have to pick an argument to dispatch on.
